Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Refill \Re*fill"\ (r?*f?l"), v. t. & i. To fill, or become full, again. [1913 Webster]

refill n 1: a prescription drug that is provided again; "he got a refill of his prescription"; "the prescription specified only one refill" 2: a commercial product that refills a container with its appropriate contents; "he got a refill for his ball-point pen"; "he got a refill for his notebook" v : fill something that had previously been emptied; "refill my glass, please" [syn: {replenish}, {fill again}]
